amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit the use of funds by any institution of higher education if compulsory student fees at that institution are used to support any group or organization for public policy influence or political campaigns.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 116 in the Congressional Record of August 1, 1995, to prohibit the dissemination of federal funds made available in the bill to any institution of higher learning that imposes a compulsory collection of student fees to support any student group or organization that engage in lobbying or attempt to influence public policy.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Solomon amendment (A021) Failed by recorded vote: 161 - 263 (Roll no. 623).
